metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6252 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in shadow 4.2.1 allows local users to gain privileges viacrafted input to newuidmap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6252` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

login - 1:4.1.5.1-1ubuntu9.4
passwd - 1:4.1.5.1-1ubuntu9.4
uidmap - 1:4.1.5.1-1ubuntu9.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: shadow package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.1.5.1-1ubuntu9.4').
